intro: Chamaeraphis rhachitricha, commonly known as the sea rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, and it is adapted to coastal environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in salt marshes and dunes. Chamaeraphis rhachitricha is also known for its ability to tolerate high salinity and is considered an important species in coastal ecosystems.
